{{Infobox criminal | name = Salvatore Miceli | image_name = Salvatore Miceli.jpg | image_size = 200px | image_caption = Mug shot of Salvatore Miceli in 1993 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1946|4|12}} | birth_place = [[Salemi]], [[Italy]] | death_date = | death_place = | cause = | alias = | motive = | charge = | conviction = | conviction_penalty = | conviction_status = | occupation = | spouse = | parents = | children = }} '''Salvatore Miceli''' (born April 12, 1946, in Salemi) is a member of the [[Sicily|Sicilian]] [[Mafia]]. He was on the "[[List of most wanted fugitives in Italy|Most wanted list]]" of the Italian Ministry of the Interior from 2001 until his arrest in Venezuela in June 2009.
==Biography== Miceli was born in [[Salemi]], [[Italy]], in the [[province of Trapani]]. He was the grandson of the notorious heroin trafficker [[Salvatore Zizzo (Mafia)|Salvatore Zizzo]].<ref name=rel0106>{{it icon}} [http://www.parlamento.it/parlam/bicam/14/Antimafia/documenti/rel.conclusiva1.pdf Relazione conclusiva], Commissione parlamentare dâinchiesta sul fenomeno della criminalitÃ organizzata mafiosa o similare, January 2006</ref> Together with [[Roberto Pannunzi]], he is considered to be the intermediary between the Mafia and the Calabrian [['Ndrangheta]] clans with Colombian cocaine cartels. He was involved in a cocaine trafficking network with [[Mariano Agate]], the Mafia boss of [[Mazara del Vallo]] and Calabrian clans of Marando, Trimboli and [[Barbaro 'ndrina|Barbaro]] from [[PlatÃ¬]].<ref name=aduc300503>{{it icon}} [http://droghe.aduc.it/php_artshow_8704.html Italia. Uno degli affari di Cosa Nostra e 'Ndrangheta insieme], ADUC droghe, May 30, 2003</ref><ref name=ad33>{{it icon}} [http://www.antimafiaduemila.com/content/view/5054/ La joint venture della droga], Antimafia Duemila, NÂ° 33 Luglio-Agosto 2003</ref>
The ring was dismantled in May 2003 â but Miceli remained at large. His wife Veronica Dudzinski and his sons Ivano and Mario Miceli were arrested in May 2003, when the cocaine trafficking network was disrupted.<ref name=mes010603>{{it icon}} [http://www.cuntrastamu.org/mafia/news/notizia.php?insid=1358 Dalla cella dava ordini al figlio laureato], Il Messaggero, June 1, 2003</ref>
Some Mafia turncoats ([[pentito|pentiti]]) referred to Miceli as the Minister of Foreign Affairs, due to his frequent trips abroad. Others called him "the chicken that lays golden eggs", referring to his lucrative drug business.<ref name=rep210609b/>
In the beginning of the 1990s, after a failed cocaine transport, Mafia boss [[Giovanni Brusca]] condemned Miceli to death. However, he was saved thanks to the intervention of [[Vincenzo Sinacori]] and [[Matteo Messina Denaro]] â the boss of [[Castelvetrano]] â who made clear that Miceli belonged to the Mafia in the [[province of Trapani]], and that the "palermitani" could not act against him without the permission of the Mafia bosses of Trapani.<ref name=ad33/><ref name=rep210609b>{{it icon}} [http://palermo.repubblica.it/dettaglio/salvatore-miceli-il-ministro-degli-esteri-di-cosa-nostra/1656827 Salvatore Miceli, 'il ministro degli Esteri' di Cosa Nostra], La Repubblica, June 21, 2009</ref>
==Arrest==
On June 20, 2009, Salvatore Miceli was arrested by police in [[Caracas]], [[Venezuela]]. The arrest was made after a joint operation between Italian and Venezuelan authorities and [[Interpol]] agents.<ref name=bbc>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/8111885.stm 'Mafia man' arrested in Venezuela], [[BBC News]], June 21, 2009</ref><ref name=reu210609>[http://in.reuters.com/article/worldNews/idINIndia-40490620090621 Italian mafia boss arrested in Venezuela], Reuters, June 21, 2009</ref> He was apprehended as he left his house on Sunday, along with two other unnamed Italian suspects.<ref name=ap210609>[http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hV_o2FzMxD_lM0FEcal6UM8XlP5wD98V31VO0 Top Italian Mafia fugitive arrested in Caracas], [[The Associated Press]], June 21, 2009</ref> Miceli, who had been on the run from authorities since 2001, had been under police surveillance for three days prior to his arrest.<ref name=bbc/><ref name=rep210609>{{it icon}} [http://palermo.repubblica.it/dettaglio/mafia-arrestato-in-venezuela-il-boss-salvatore-miceli/1656815 Mafia, arrestato in Venezuela: Il boss Salvatore Miceli], La Repubblica, June 21, 2009</ref> The former head of Italy's [[Antimafia Commission|Antimafia parliamentary commission]], [[Giuseppe Lumia]], suggested that Miceli's arrest would be a major blow to the [[Cosa Nostra|Sicilian Mafia]] and their trans-Atlantic drug trafficking operations.<ref name=reu210609/>
Venezuela extradited Miceli to Italy on June 30, 2009, to serve his prison term. He was convicted for drug trafficking and Mafia conspiracy in 2001.<ref name=rep300609>{{it icon}} [http://www.repubblica.it/2009/03/sezioni/cronaca/mafia-7/miceli-estradato/miceli-estradato.html Il Venezuela estrada il boss Miceli], La Repubblica, June 30, 2009</ref> Since then he again has been charged for cocaine trafficking between Colombia, Sicily and Calabria.<ref name=ad220609>{{it icon}} [http://www.antimafiaduemila.com/content/view/17132/84/ Cosa Nostra e i narcos: la storia di Salvatore Miceli, il boss del narcotraffico], Antmafia Duemila, June 22, 2009</ref>
